College of Applied Health Sciences     Search the site      Toggle Menu     Search             College of Applied Health Sciences     College of Applied Health Sciences   Google Translate  Main Menu    Applying          Degrees and Deadlines    Beyond the Classroom    Tuition and Aid    Newly Admitted Students      Academics           Departments and Programs         Biomedical and Health Information Sciences           Disability and Human Development           Kinesiology and Nutrition           Occupational Therapy           Physical Therapy           Rehabilitation Sciences         Departments and Programs      Research          Research Labs and Centers    Metabolic Kitchen      Community Services          Assistive Technology Unit    Developmental Disabilities Family Clinic    Occupational Therapy Faculty Practice    Physical Therapy Faculty Practice      Alumni          Give to AHS          Give to AHS    Where to Give      AHS Alumni Awards          Alumni Award Recipients      Meet Our Alumni    Corporate Partners Program    News    Events    Contact      About AHS          College News    College Calendar    Committees    Contact       Eyebrow menu    Inside AHS    AHS Directory    Give to AHS    UIC menu    UIC.edu    UI Health    Campus Map      Search the site                     COVID-19 on Inside AHS  COVID-19 updates, resources and announcements for AHS students, faculty and staff                    College of  Applied Health  Sciences                 Research      View Menu            Breadcrumbs   Home  Research      Research  Research at the intersection of health, disability and rehabilitation  The UIC College of Applied Health Sciences is consistently ranked among the top 10 nationwide in research funding for colleges of allied health.  AHS researchers are awarded grants from a variety of federal and state agencies and foundations. Their research includes laboratory-based studies, community-based projects and scholarship in the humanities.      Fiscal year 2019 by the numbers    Stats and Facts     83  grants awarded to AHS faculty as primary principal investigators         $315,802  in sponsored program expenditures per tenured-track faculty (FTE)         $12,426,871  total sponsored program expenditures          Sponsored program expenditures (per fiscal year)      2019   73%  12%  15%     2018   75%  12%  12%     2017   73%  15%  13%      Federal  Private  State               Participation  Removing barriers to social participation among people with disabilities by empowering them with entrepreneurship training                   Policy  Evaluating policies and programs that impact individuals with disabilities and advocating for reform                   Balance  Helping older adults and prosthetic wearers find balance and avoid damaging falls                   Diabetes  Transforming the lives of people with diabetes by improving wound-healing                   Obesity  Collaborating across disciplines to provide better healthcare for older adults with online training                   Aging  Collaborating across disciplines to provide better healthcare for older adults with online training                   Recovery  Improving patients' ability to walk after a stroke using brain stimulation and gait training                   Autism  Creating teaching resources and learning moments for children with autism and their families                   Data simplification  Raising the bar in standards and processes for creating, using, and protecting health information to improve clinical outcomes                  What we're researching    Top research topics among AHS faculty. Select to see faculty studying a topic. We let you focus on scientific development while we manage the review and submission of your proposals.
